classes.point:
An invisible and directional spotlight. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.
Distance at which brightness should fall off to 50%. If set, overrides linear constant and quadratic paramaters. Distance at which brightness should fall off to negligible (1/256)%. Must set _fifty_percent_distance to use.
This is the distance that light is allowed to cast, in inches.

An entity that does nothing itself, but can be used to specify the destination for a trigger_teleport entity. An info_target can be used instead. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.

The first node in set of nodes that are used to place ropes in the world. It should connect to 1 or more keyframe_rope entities. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. Name of the next keyframe along this keyframe path.
How much extra length the rope has (by default it has the length between its two endpoints in the editor).
Number of subdivisions between each rope segment. Maximum value is 8. Higher values make smoother ropes, but are slower to render. Test effect that makes the rope look sharper and more barbed. Width of the rope. This changes the texture resolution. The default resolution is 4 pixels per inch. Larger values stretch the texture and smaller values scrunch it up.
When set to Yes, the rope starts out detached from its target endpoint. When set to yes, the rope can be detached from either endpoint when shot. The material to use when rendering the rope. Curve Type. Currently only type 2 (Rope) is fully supported. Sets the color and angle of the light from the sun and sky. ----- KEYS ----- This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis. The downward pitch of the light from the sun. 0 is horizontal, -90 is straight down.
The angular extent of the sun for casting soft shadows. Higher numbers are more diffuse. 5 is a good starting value. An entity to control the color correction in the map. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
This is the distance to the start of the falloff region (-1 = everywhere) This is the distance to the end of the falloff region (-1 = everywhere) This is the maximum weight for this lookup This is the lookup table filename Duration of fade in on when enabled. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Titanfall

An entity that acts like a magnet for ragdolls. Useful for crafting exaggerated ragdoll behavior (i.e. guys falling over rails on death). If the Bar Magnet spawnflag is set, the magnet works like it was a cylindrical magnet i.e. it attracts ragdolls to the nearest point on a line. ----- KEYS ----- This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.
Radius in which ragdolls are affected around this entity's origin. Magnetic force to apply to ragdolls within the radius. Expressed as kilograms per inch per second. So a force of 1000 will add 10 inches/second to a 100kg man. It will add 100 inches per second to a 10kg headcrab. ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: spawnflags Removed: target, targetname, StartDisabled, parentname TODO: identify changes

An entity that controls the HDR tonemapping for the player. Think of it as a method of controlling the exposure of the player's eyes. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source

classes.point: This entity indicates the position and facing direction at which the player will spawn. Any number of info_player_start entities may be placed in a map for when working in cordoned-off portions of the map. When multiple info_player_start entities are present in a map, set the 'Master' spawnflag on one of them to indicate which one should be used when running the entire map. ----- KEYS ----- This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis. An entity used to control the LOD behavior of any water in the map. If your map has water, this entity is required. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This is the distance from the camera that water will start transitioning to cheap water, in inches. This is the distance from the camera that water will finish transitioning to cheap water, in inches. ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source

An invisible omnidirectional lightsource. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
Amount to scale the light by when compiling for HDR.
Distance at which brightness should fall off to 50%. If set, overrides linear constant and quadratic paramaters. Distance at which brightness should fall off to negligible (1/256)%. Must set _fifty_percent_distance to use. This is the distance that light is allowed to cast, in inches. classes.group:
A trigger volume that damages entities that touch it. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. The position of this entity's center in the world. Rotating entities typically rotate around their origin.
The amount of damage done to entities that touch this trigger. The damage is done every half-second. See also 'Damage Model' for extra details on how damage can be dealt. Maximum damage dealt per second. This field is only used if you select the Doubling w/Forgiveness damage model, via the spawnflag. How damage is dealt. Normal always does the specified amount of damage each half second. Doubling starts with the specified amount and doubles it each time it hurts the toucher. Forgiveness means that if the toucher gets out of the trigger the damage will reset to the specified value. Good for making triggers that are deadly over time without having to cause massive damage on each touch. Should the damaged entity receive no physics force from this trigger. Minimum speed of wind gusts. Maximum speed of wind gusts. Minimum time delay between random gusts. Maximum time delay between random gusts. How long will the wind gust for. Maximum amount that the wind's direction changes due to a gust. New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: scale TODO: identify changes

A trigger volume that can be triggered multiple times. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. The position of this entity's center in the world. Rotating entities typically rotate around their origin.
Amount of time, in seconds, after the trigger_multiple has triggered before it can be triggered again. If set to -1, it will never trigger again (in which case you should just use a trigger_once). New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify

classes.group:
This is the world entity. Each map can only contain one, and it's automatically created for you. ----- KEYS -----
Chapter Title that appears onscreen when this level starts. Number of pixels wide at which all props in the level start to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist). This number is ignored if the prop has a specific fade distance specified. Minimum number of pixels wide at which the prop is visible (0 = don't fade out). This number is ignored if the prop has a specific fade distance specified. Detail.vbsp file to use for emitting detail props (found in directory <root>/modname) Material for detail sprites to use for drawing detail props New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: editor_drLastCameraAngle, editor_drLastCameraPos, maxblobcount, spawnclass, name, instance, world_maxs, mapversion, ClientSide, musicpostfix, world_mins Removed: minoccluderarea, maxoccludeearea, startdark, maxoccludeearea_x360, minoccluderarea_x360, ResponseContext, newunit, targetname, coldworld, gametitle TODO: identify changes
classes.point:
A prop that physically simulates as a single rigid body. It can be constrained to other physics objects using hinges or other constraints. It can also be configured to break when it takes enough damage. Note that the health of the object will be overridden by the health inside the model, to ensure consistent health game-wide. If the model used by the prop is configured to be used as a prop_dynamic (i.e. it should not be physically simulated) then it CANNOT be used as a prop_physics. Upon level load it will display a warning in the console and remove itself. Use a prop_dynamic instead. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. This entity's orientation in the world. Pitch is rotation around the Y axis, yaw is the rotation around the Z axis, roll is the rotation around the X axis.
Some models have multiple versions of their textures, called skins. Set this to a number other than 0 to use that skin instead of the default.
If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. See also 'Explosion Radius'. If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion with a radius of the specified amount. See also 'Explosion Damage'. Used to limit the amount of gibs produced when this entity breaks, for performance reasons. Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart). If you specify a fade in the worldspawn, or if the engine is running under dx7, then the engine will forcibly fade out props even if fademindist/fademaxdist isn't specified. This scale factor gives you some control over the fade. Using 0 here turns off the forcible fades. Numbers smaller than 1 cause the prop to fade out at further distances, and greater than 1 cause it to fade out at closer distances. The prop will ignore any damage events if the damage is less than this amount. Use this to override how far this object casts shadows. 0 = default distance. Scales damage energy when this object is hit by a physics object. NOTE: 0 means this feature is disabled for backwards compatibility. Set to 1.0 for materials as strong as flesh, smaller numbers indicate stronger materials.
Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the brush to move. Scales the angular mass of an object. Used to hack angular damage and collision response. A scale multiplier for the object's mass. If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Once its health has dropped below this specified amount, it will enable motion. If specified, this object will start motion disabled. Any impact that imparts a force greater than this value on the physbox will enable motion.
Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'. The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode. The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.

classes.point:
An entity that works like env_soundscape except that it works in conjunction with trigger_soundscape to determine when a player hears it. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
If set to -1, then the player can hear the soundscape as long as he can see it (regardless of distance to it). The name of the soundscape to use. Corresponds to an entry in the soundscapes*.txt file in the hl2\scripts directory. New in Titanfall; TODO: identify ----- NOTES ----- Introduced by Source Added: requireLOS Removed: position0, position2, position6, position7, position5, position1, parentname, position3, position4 TODO: identify changes
classes.group:
A breakable surface, for partially breakable glass / tile / etc. All faces but the desired visible one must be marked as NODRAW and thatface must be 4 sided. The material applied to the visible face must be set up to be breakable. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by.
Set to the best approximation of the size and material of this entity's brushes. If set, it will override this entity's health and damage taken from various weapons. See the propdata.txt file in the scripts directory of your MOD to get a detailed list of what each entry specifies. The amount of damage the surface takes before breaking. Set to the material type of the brush. Used to decide what sounds to make when damaged, and what gibs to produce when broken. Used to decide which direction to throw gibs when broken. Specifies the direction to throw gibs when this breakable breaks. Be sure to select Use Precise Gib Dir in the Gibs Direction field! Used to determine whether or not damage should cause the brush to move. When broken, an entity of the selected type will be created. If non-zero, when this entity breaks it will create an explosion that causes the specified amount of damage. Delay, in seconds, after 'broken' by pressure before breaking apart (allows for sound to play before breaking apart). Used to set a non-standard rendering mode on this entity. See also 'FX Amount' and 'FX Color'. The FX amount is used by the selected Render Mode. The FX color is used by the selected Render Mode.
If the 'Surface Type' is set to Glass, this value sets how fragile the glass pieces are after the surface has been broken.

An brush built entity with various features. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. The position of this entity's center in the world. Rotating entities typically rotate around their origin.
If set, then the excluded NPC class will consider this brush solid, and all other NPC classes will consider it non-solid. Set this if this brush is in heirarchy with a moving object of some kind, and the player can stand on this brush. Set this if this brush casts lightmap shadows. A node entity that marks a point in a rope. The first node in the rope should be a move_rope, followed by 1 or more keyframe_ropes. ----- KEYS ----- The name that other entities refer to this entity by. Name of the next keyframe along this keyframe path.
How much extra length the rope has (by default it has the length between its two endpoints in the editor).
Number of subdivisions between each rope segment. Maximum value is 8. Higher values make smoother ropes, but are slower to render. Test effect that makes the rope look sharper and more barbed. This changes the texture resolution. The default resolution is 4 pixels per inch. Larger values stretch the texture and smaller values scrunch it up.
When set to Yes, the rope starts out detached from its target endpoint. When set to yes, the rope can be detached from either endpoint when shot. The material to use when rendering the rope.
